title: What's the output of Intl.NumberFormat with unit and currency?
explanation: `Intl.NumberFormat` with `unit: 'mile-per-hour'` formats `130` as `'130 mph'`. With `currency: 'USD'`, `300` becomes `'$300.00'`.

options.text: `The driver drove 130 and has to pay 300`
`The driver drove 130 mph and has to pay $300.00`
`The driver drove undefined and has to pay undefined`
`The driver drove 130.00 and has to pay 300.00`

title: What's the output of object destructuring assignment to array index?
explanation: Destructuring assignment can target array indices. `{ item: spookyItems[3] } = { item: 'ðŸ’€' }` assigns `'ðŸ’€'` to `spookyItems[3]`, mutating the array.

title: What's the output of Number.isNaN vs isNaN?
explanation: `Number.isNaN` only returns `true` for actual `NaN` values. `isNaN` coerces the value first, so non-numbers like strings return `true`.

title: What's the output with TDZ inside function?
explanation: The `randomValue` inside `getInfo` is block-scoped and hoisted but not initialized. Accessing it before declaration throws `ReferenceError` due to TDZ.

title: What's the output with async/await, try/catch, and finally?
explanation: `finally` always runs, regardless of success or failure. The promise resolves, so `'Woah some cool data'` and `'Oh finally!'` are logged.

title: What's the output of Array.flat(1)?
explanation: `flat(1)` flattens only one level deep. The innermost array `['ðŸ•', 'ðŸ•']` remains nested.

title: What's the output when assigning object reference?
explanation: `counterTwo` is a reference to the same object as `counterOne`. Modifying via `counterTwo` affects `counterOne`.

title: What's the output with microtasks and macrotasks ordering?
explanation: Sync logs first (`Last line 1!`, `Promise 2!`, `Last line 2!`). Then microtasks (`Promise 1!`). Finally macrotasks (`Timeout 1!`, `Timeout 2!`).

options.text: `Promise 1! Last line 1! Promise 2! Last line 2! Timeout 1! Timeout 2!`
`Last line 1! Timeout 1! Promise 1! Last line 2! Promise2! Timeout 2! `
`Last line 1! Promise 2! Last line 2! Promise 1! Timeout 1! Timeout 2!`
`Timeout 1! Promise 1! Last line 1! Promise 2! Timeout 2! Last line 2!`

title: How to invoke default export with import * as?
explanation: `import * as` bundles all exports into an object. Default export is accessible via `.default`.

options.text: `Default aren't imported with *`, only named exports

title: What's the output with Proxy set and get traps?
explanation: Proxy `set` trap triggers on assignment, `get` trap on property access. Both log messages.

title: Which modifies object after Object.seal?
explanation: `Object.seal` prevents adding/removing properties but allows modifying existing property values.

title: Which modifies object after Object.freeze?
explanation: `Object.freeze` is shallow. Nested objects like `address` can still be modified.

title: What's the output with default parameter referencing another?
explanation: Default parameters are evaluated at call time. First call: `num=2`, `value=add(2)=4`. Second: `num=3`, `value=add(3)=6`.

title: What's the output accessing private class field?
explanation: Private fields (prefixed with `#`) cannot be accessed outside the class. Attempting to do so throws a `SyntaxError`.

title: What's missing to yield nested generator values?
explanation: `yield*` delegates to another generator or iterable, yielding its values directly.

title: What's the output with mutable default parameter?
explanation: Second and third calls use the same `person.hobbies` array reference, so `'dancing'` and `'baking'` are added to it.

title: What's the output of class inheritance with super()?
explanation: Child constructor runs first (`I'm pink`), then `super()` calls parent constructor (`I'm a bird`).

title: Which option results in an error with const array?
explanation: `const` prevents reassignment (`emojis = ...`), but allows mutation of the array itself.

title: What to add to make object iterable with [...person]?
content:
What do we need to add to the `person` object to get `["Lydia Hallie", 21]` as the output of `[...person]`?

```javascript
const person = {
  name: "Lydia Hallie",
  age: 21
}
[...person] // ["Lydia Hallie", 21]
```
explanation: Objects aren't iterable by default. Adding `[Symbol.iterator]` that yields `Object.values(this)` makes it work.

options.text: `*[Symbol.iterator]() { for (let x in this) yield* this[x] }`
`*[Symbol.iterator]() { for (let x in this) yield this }`

title: What's the output of forEach with falsy check?
explanation: `0` is falsy, so skipped. `1`, `2`, `3` are truthy â†’ `count = 3`.

title: What's the output with optional chaining on nested arrays?
content:
What's the output?

```javascript
function getFruit(fruits) {
	console.log(fruits?.[1]?.[1])
}
getFruit([['ðŸŠ', 'ðŸŒ'], ['ðŸ']])
getFruit()
getFruit([['ðŸ'], ['ðŸŠ', 'ðŸŒ']])
```
explanation: First: `['ðŸ'][1]` â†’ `undefined`. Second: `fruits` is `undefined` â†’ `undefined`. Third: `['ðŸŠ','ðŸŒ'][1]` â†’ `'ðŸŒ'`.

title: What's the output with separate class instances?
explanation: `new Calc().increase()` creates a separate instance. `calc.count` remains `0`.

title: What's the output of object reference equality?
explanation: `updateUser` returns the same `user` object reference, so strict equality is `true`.

title: What's the output with slice, splice, and unshift?
content:
What's the output?

```javascript
const fruit = ['ðŸŒ', 'ðŸŠ', 'ðŸŽ']
fruit.slice(0, 1)
fruit.splice(0, 1)
fruit.unshift('ðŸ‡')
console.log(fruit)
```
explanation: `slice` doesnâ€™t mutate. `splice(0,1)` removes `'ðŸŒ'`. `unshift('ðŸ‡')` adds to front â†’ `['ðŸ‡', 'ðŸŠ', 'ðŸŽ']`.

title: What's the output using objects as Map keys?
explanation: Object keys are stringified to `'[object Object]'`. Both `dog` and `cat` become the same key, so the second assignment overwrites the first.

title: What's the output with arrow function method and this?
explanation: Arrow functions donâ€™t bind `this`. `this.email = email` sets a global property, not `user.email`.

title: What's the output of Promise.all with one rejected promise?
explanation: `Promise.all` rejects immediately if any promise rejects. The `catch` block logs the rejection reason `'Third'`.

title: What method creates object from key-value pairs?
explanation: `Object.fromEntries` converts an array of `[key, value]` pairs into an object.

title: What's the output with default object parameter?
explanation: Default `address = {}` is an empty object (truthy), so `address ? address : null` returns `{}`.

title: What's the output with !typeof comparison?
explanation: `typeof randomValue` is `'number'` (truthy). `!typeof randomValue` is `false`. `false === 'string'` is `false`, so `else` runs.
